articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Senate impeachment trial has caused a 'change in demeanor' on Capitol Hill
articles.description: NBC News' Garrett Haake discusses the changes he has seen and felt on Capitol Hill now that the articles of impeachment have been delivered to the Senate and the trial begins.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: McCaskill explains the importance of the Senate floor’s ‘ghostwriter’
articles.description: As the Senate accepts the articles of impeachment, former Senator Claire McCaskill explains the role Elizabeth McDonough, the first woman parliamentarian of the Senate.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Kamala Harris on impeachment trial: ‘This is the time to do justice’
articles.description: MSNBC’s Kasie Hunt speaks with Sen. Kamala Harris, D-Calif., discusses the official beginning of the Trump impeachment Senate impeachment trial.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Matthews: ‘Instant drama’ missing from impeachment procedures
articles.description: MSNBC’s Chris Matthews compares the climate in Washington today, surrounding Trump’s impeachment, to President Nixon’s impeachment and why it feels like "instant drama" is missing from the proceedings.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: On impeachment, a step forward and a step back from Susan Collins
articles.description: Susan Collins "wonders why" these details from Parnas are "only now being revealed," but there's no reason to wonder.
articles.content:
More than most Senate Republicans, Sen. Susan Collins (R-Maine) has been open to hearing witness testimony in Donald Trump’s impeachment trial, and yesterday, the Maine Republican said she’d effectively succeeded.
As the New York Timesreported, Senate Majori… [+2547 chars]

articles.title: Why Parnas interview was a 'political earthquake'
articles.description: The Morning Joe panel continues its discussion on the revelations contained in Lev Parnas' bombshell interview.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Chris Van Hollen on GAO report: 'This is a bombshell'
articles.description: Nonpartisan U.S. Government Accountability Office, the GAO, concluded that the Trump administration violated the law in withholding the aid to Ukraine. Democratic Senator Chris Van Hollen, who last month, called for the federal watchdog group to look into the…

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Ukraine to investigate Burisma hacking
articles.description: Ukraine has launched criminal investigations into the possible illegal surveillance of former U.S. ambassador Marie Yovanovitch, and the reported hacking of Burisma Holdings, the natural gas company at the center of the Trump impeachment.

articles.title: Morning Joe 1/16/20
articles.description: Joe and Mika discuss the big news of the day.

articles.title: Thursday's Campaign Round-Up, 1.16.20
articles.description: Today's installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.
articles.content:
Today’s installment of campaign-related news items from across the country.

articles.title: Memo to Trump: 'You'll never measure up to Obama'
articles.description: For this week's memo, Rev. Al addresses President Trump's unsolvable envy for his predecessor, President Barack Obama.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Pelosi: Parnas interview shows Barr was 'implicated' in effort to withhold Ukraine aid
articles.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, D-Calif., said "there would be a special prosecutor appointed" if allegations Lev Parnas claimed about Attorney General William Barr being involved with the effort to withhold aid from Ukraine were accurate.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: The problem with Blackburn's call for Dem recusals in Trump trial
articles.description: "Their presidential ambitions prohibit their ability to view this trial through an objective lens"? I don't follow the logic.
articles.content:
As the Senate prepares for the start of Donald Trump’s impeachment trial, first-year Sen. Marsha Blackburn (R-Tenn.) wants to see some of her colleagues recuse themselves from the proceedings.

articles.title: Pelosi: Government watchdog 'confirmed' withholding aid from Ukraine was illegal

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Government watchdog finds Trump administration violated law by withholding Ukraine aid
articles.description: The Government Accountability Office found that the Trump administration violated the law by withholding aid to Ukraine. NBC News' Ken Dilanian has details on the report's findings.

articles.author: Steve Benen
articles.title: Federal watchdog agency: Trump broke law with Ukraine scheme
articles.description: Trump's Ukraine scheme wasn't just scandalous; according to Congress' non-partisan watchdog agency, it was also illegal.
articles.content:
As Donald Trump’s impeachment scandal has unfolded, one of the principal Republican arguments has focused on whether or not the president committed a criminal offense. This has long been an unfortune line of defense, which is suddenly quite a bit worse.

articles.title: 'Rudy Giuliani is responsible for the impeachment' of Trump
articles.description: The panel continues its discussion on Lev Parnas' interview with MSNBC's Rachel Maddow and Rudy Giuliani's role in the Ukraine plot.
